result.execSummary:
The defendant Garett William Helminiak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Garett William Helminiak
parties.address: 7027 South Tumble Creek Drive, Franklin, WI 53132

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge in full by 3-12-2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

Consecutive to: To any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and for the birth of expected child; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.
Provide a DNA sample if not already done.

Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

Concurrent with: Count 3 and consecutive to Count 1 or to any other sentence, with credit for 64 days time served.
Court approved participation in Dosage Probation Pilot Program and early termination of probation if defendant successfully completes program and all other conditions of probation.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Maintain full time work and/or school.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
No contact with Corey P.
Defendant to provide a DNA sample if not already provided.

Maintain absolute sobriety. no alcohol.
Alcohol and Drug assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug assessment treatment or sobriety group per week.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Count 2 and consecutive to Count 1 and to any other sentence, with credit for 64 days time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garett William Helminiak

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered the letter filed be by the Court. Sealed and filed.

Defendant Garett William Helminiak in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Garett William Helminiak in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO COUNT  1, 2 & 3- 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
AS TO COUNT 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; release for the Day Reporting Center and for the birth of expected child; credit for 0 days time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge in full by 3-12-2017. Any remaining balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 3 and consecutive to COUNT 1 or to any other sentence, with credit for 64 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 12 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 12 MONTHS.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the below conditions.
AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 2 YEARS, concurrent to COUNT 2 and consecutive to COUNT 1 or to any other sentence, with credit for 64 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.  
Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 3 YEARS with the below conditions.
As to  Count 2 & 3 CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- Defendant must attend at least 1 Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  treatment or sobriety support group per week. 
 - No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Maintain full time work and/or school. 
- No contact with Corey P. 
- Defendant to provide a DNA sample if not already provided. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent.  Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 
- Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
-Court advises the Defendant that under Wisconsin Statute 302.113 the amount actually served may be extended, and that the Defendant could serve the entire bifurcated sentence in prison. The Defendant will be subject to certain conditions while on release to extended supervision, and a violation of any of those conditions may result in the Defendant being returned to prison. 

-Court approved participation in Dosage Probation Pilot Program and early termination of probation if defendant successfully completes program and all other conditions of probation.
Appellate rights notice given to the defendant.

Attorney Jerome J. Shimek in court, defendant Garett William Helminiak not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case in court with 13CF4518.  Parties inform the court that cases may resolve with a global resolution.  Court ordered case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Garett William Helminiak in court with attorney Jerome J. Shimek.  Defendant Garett William Helminiak in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Garett William Helminiak in court with attorney Barbara K Due.  Defendant Garett William Helminiak in custody.  Sarra M. Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
